summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Office Memorandum detailing the medical emergency response to inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It describes finding Epstein unresponsive in his cell and the initiation of CPR.

persons.name: Epstein, J
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell during a medical emergency.

persons.name: Correctional Officer Lieutenant
persons.context: A correctional officer who was performing CPR on inmate Epstein when the responding officer arrived.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: An officer who assisted with CPR during the transport to Health Services.

connections.description: The Correctional Officer Lieutenant was performing CPR on inmate Epstein during the medical emergency.
The Physician Assistant was performing CPR on inmate Epstein during the medical emergency.
The officer assisted with CPR on inmate Epstein during transport to Health Services.

events.title: Medical Emergency of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell. CPR was initiated by correctional and medical staff, and he was transported to Health Services.

keyFacts: The medical emergency involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein occurred on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 a.m.
Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell in the 9 South unit.
CPR was in progress by a Correctional Officer Lieutenant and a Physician Assistant when the responding officer arrived.
The document is a confidential Bureau of Prisons memorandum regarding the incident.
